Package cputils

Class FileUtils

java.lang.Object
cputils.FileUtils
public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
Methods for reading and writing files; exceptions handled.
Version:
13-Oct-2008, 25-Oct-2010, 09-Oct-2012, 25-Sep-2020
Author:
Stephen Monk

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.lang.String[] readIntoArray​(java.lang.String fileName)
    Reads the lines of a file into an array of strings.
    static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readIntoList​(java.lang.String fileName)
    Reads the lines of a file into a List of strings.
    static void writeArrayToFile​(java.lang.String[] lines, java.lang.String fileName)
    Writes the contents of an array to a file, one element per line.
    static void writeListToFile​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines, java.lang.String fileName)
    Writes the contents of a List of strings to a file, one element per line.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • readIntoList

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readIntoList​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Reads the lines of a file into a List of strings.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file
      Returns:
      a list of strings, such that each element is one line from the file. The list is empty in the case of an I/O error.

    • readIntoArray

      public static java.lang.String[] readIntoArray​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Reads the lines of a file into an array of strings.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file
      Returns:
      an array such that each element contains one line from the file, or a zero-length array in the case of an I/O error.

    • writeListToFile

      public static void writeListToFile​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines, java.lang.String fileName)
      Writes the contents of a List of strings to a file, one element per line. If the specified file already exists, it will be over-written. If the specified file does not exist, it will be created.
      Parameters:
      lines - the list of Strings to be written
      fileName - the file to write to

    • writeArrayToFile

      public static void writeArrayToFile​(java.lang.String[] lines, java.lang.String fileName)
      Writes the contents of an array to a file, one element per line. If the specified file already exists, it will be over-written. If the specified file does not exist, it will be created.
      Parameters:
      lines - the array to be written
      fileName - the file to write to
